PARAGRAPH.STRING: (33°24'N,35°51'E; [Hebrew: הר חרמון], Har Hermon, [Arabic: جبل الشيخ], Jabal el-Shaiykh, Djabl a-Shekh, "mountain of the chief" and "snowy mountain") is a mountain in the Anti-Lebanon mountain range.
highest point is 2,814 m (9,230 feet) above sea level. This summit is on the border between Syria and Lebanon, and is under Syrian control. The southern slopes of
have been part of Israel since 1967.
